Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: Facility maintained an inaccurate placement record, resulting in
overpayment.
INVESTIGATION:
Allegation was made that the agency was improperly billing the treatment foster care
rate for Youth A who was being supervised in a foster home that was not a treatment
foster care home.
I interviewed DHHS Program Manager 1 by telephone on 07/26/2022. DHHS Program
Manager 1 provided contact information for DHHS Analyst 1 and FC Manager 1. DHHS
Program Manager 1 stated the agency is cooperative with working with DHHS to
resolve the funding billing process.
I interviewed DHHS Analyst 1 by telephone on 07/26/2022. DHHS Analyst 1 stated it
was discovered that the agency was improperly billing for Youth A starting May 23,
2022. DHHS Analyst 1 stated they had a meeting with the agency on 07/13/2022 to
address/resolve the incorrect billing issue. DHHS Analyst 1 stated the last time period
of the billing error was 06/22/2022. DHHS Analyst 1 stated the agency was fully
2

cooperative in working to correct the error. DHHS Analyst 1 reported the agency was
providing the additional supervision associated with a treatment foster care placement
so the agency thought they could bill that additional rate even though the foster home
placement itself was not identified as a treatment foster home.
I interviewed Foster Care Manager 1 at the agency on 07/28/2022. Foster Care
Manager 1 reported the situation similar to the description provided by DHHS Analyst 1.
Foster Care Manager 1 stated the situation was corrected by 07/15/2022 following the
meeting with DHHS on 07/13/2022. Foster Care Manager 1 stated in the future they
would discuss a situation with DHHS Analyst 1 if there were any questions/concerns.
I completed an exit conference by telephone with Administrator 1. Administrator 1
reported the funding issue had been corrected and everyone has received the proper
compensation.
APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 903-03 Payment for Foster Family/Relative Care
Fund sources are generated through service authorizations
that are routed, approved and amended in MISACWIS.
ANALYSIS: The agency had a misunderstanding of the criteria associated
with the funding source in this situation. The agency was
providing the level of supervision associated with the
expectations of one funding source and thought that was
adequate to bill for services accordingly. However, in this
situation the foster home providing placement did not meet all
the criteria so the billing that was processed was not
appropriate. The error was identified during the DHHS
monitoring process and a meeting was held to initiate corrective
action. The agency was cooperative in the correction process.
Both DHHS monitors and agency representatives reported the
error has been corrected and the current billing is appropriate.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
